subject: Re: [junit] adding rudimentary timing to a TestCase via a TestDecorator
msgSnippet: can u give me the code so i will try to solve our problem -- slack@accesscom.com wrote:  Hello! ... ===== RISHIKESH
messageBody:
can u give me the code
so i will try to solve our problem
-- slack@... wrote: > Hello!
>
> I am a new JUnit user and member of this group, many
> thanks for the
> helpful examples in the messages archive and the
> files section.
>
> I am attempting to provide the option of having
> rudimentary timing
> functionality when I run my TestCases -- the
> TestCase class itself
> does not contain the timestamp logging, but rather a
> TestDecorator
> (or TestSetup?) class does the logging.
>
> I currently have a TimedTestSetup class that logs in
> the setUp and
> tearDown methods, but it is producing erratic
> results -- multiple
> loggings for a single test.
>
> If anyone could point to a TestDecorator example
> that would help me
> add rudimentary timestamp logging to my TestCases, I
> sure would
> appreciate it.
>
> Thanks
> Mark Huisman
>
>
>

=====
RISHIKESH
